AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: court that imposed judgment of conviction and sentence, may accept guilty plea and enter final judgment, adopted the Report and Recommendation of the United States Magistrate Judge, calculated the criminal history and sentenced Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa, considered for 'fast track' downward departure
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa was removed from and later found, and party to a plea agreement and prosecutor in the case, referenced in context of 'fast track' program
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Bureau of Prisons: custody provider for Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa's imprisonment, responsible for holding Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa in custody
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico: country where Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa is a native and citizen
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Department of Homeland Security: department whose Secretary can grant permission to re-enter the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Attorney General: official who can grant permission to re-enter the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission: issuer of the Guidelines Manual, consulted in determining sentence, issued Amendment 740 and Amendment 742
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Judge: judge before whom the defendant pleads guilty and decides on sentencing, calculated the criminal history and sentenced Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Magistrate Judge: judge who recommends acceptance of guilty plea and prepared the Report and Recommendation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Guidelines: guidelines used for calculating criminal history points and applying applicable guidelines, consulted in determining sentence, includes amendments such as Amendment 740 for cultural assimilation and Amendment 742 for elimination of recency points
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa: defendant who filed objections in support of a motion for downward departure, has a history of violating immigration laws, sentenced to 90 months of imprisonment, alleges counsel was ineffective for failing to recognize amendments to the United States Sentencing Guidelines and for not investigating claim of United States citizenship
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Probation Office: office that prepared a presentence report calculating the advisory Guideline imprisonment range
